channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street Light Out, 24th February
item.description:
The Main Street light outside No 40 has been out for about a week and is making it very dark. Also I have had problems with being broken into and this is now having a massive impact on my mental health that this isn’t working.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Riverview Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crossing never turns green for pedestrians. You press the button, it lights up to show it’s registered, it never goes green and after a certain amount of time the lit up button turns off again., 24th February
item.description:
The pedestrian crossing on gchq side of a40 right next to the road leading to gchq
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road surface has broken to form a ledge/curb in the road rather than a traditional pothole, 24th February
item.description:
The road surface close to no 18 Ewens Road has broken/fractured to form a long ledge or curb in the road. There is a significant difference in the height of the road surface where it has fractured.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Ewens Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Verge turned over by tarmac not replaced after works carried out last year., 24th February
item.description:
After necessary works carried out last year and verge dug up it was unfortunately infilled with soil for some reason and not replaced with tarmac hence the quagmire it has left behind. I do not know where the cones have appeared from, can only assume it is from either the council or a resident .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti (white aerosol paint) sprayed on 'double chevron' road sign, 24th February
item.description:
'Double chevron' sign on St James roundabout, Honeybourne Way, facing uphill towards St George's Road. Roundabout is in front of Waitrose filling station and below Millennium footbridge. Seen on Sat 17th Feb 2024. What3Words location = total.else.jungle. Note that the photos are from Google Street View and pre-date the graffiti.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint James' Roundabout, St Paul’s, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Apologies to add to the long list but I have counted 25+ potholes from Morrissons up to the Turing for Broad Oak Way. I realise that many repairs are taking place at the moment but would consider that the top part of the road is a concern. Please could you consider a full surface coverage including all the speed bumps?, 24th February
item.description:
Majority of Caernarvon Road including the speed bumps which have eroded quite badly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 123, Caernarvon Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
